message: Easy. Download and work tour way through the Ruby Koans

Right now, I am also learning Ruby. I found the 'Beginning Ruby' book by Peter Cooper (http://www.amazon.com/Beginning-Ruby-Professional-Peter-Cooper/dp/1430223634/ref=dp_ob_title_bk) to be extremely helpful. I am about 200 pages into the book and found the book to be very much newbie friendly.
I also did the Ruby Koans before, but I will be re-doing them after I finish the book, because I will get much more out of them that way, and the Koans are really a great learning tool.
I'm learning Ruby right now as well. I found "The Well-Grounded Rubyist" to be a fantastic intro.

If you want a little more interactive/structured method (with a bit of hand-holding), I recommend the Core Ruby class at http://rubylearning.org/class/ . I took that last year and really got a lot out of it.
Better still, perhaps, would be Mendicant University: http://university.rubymendicant.com/

Once the basics are set, practice with http://projecteuler.net/index.php?section=problems

I'll be teaching a intro to programming course this semester and decided that ruby would be a good starting language, I'll be coming back here for tips...
You can try videos at http://showmedo.com/
Anyone late to this thread: try rubymonk.com
